thread.title: Liam Gallagher Produced Memorable Tweets During Champions League Tie Last Night
thread.title_full: Liam Gallagher Produced Memorable Tweets During Champions League Tie Last Night

title: Liam Gallagher Produced Memorable Tweets During Champions League Tie Last Night
text:
Liam Gallagher Produced Memorable Tweets During Champions League Tie Last Night Wed Feb 22 2017 08:37:06   08:37:06 GMT+0000 (GMT) Jack Kenmare Jack Kenmare in football 
Manchester City knocked five past a strong Monaco side last night as we all sat back and witnessed arguably one of the most entertaining Champions League fixtures in years. Even Liam Gallagher was impressed, for the most part. 
Twitter exploded during and after the game, and one of Manchester City's biggest fans, Liam Gallagher, produced a typically nonchalant post on Twitter to describe the performance of referee Antonio Mateu Lahoz. 
Manchester City were denied a penalty by Spanish referee Lahoz when striker Sergio Aguero appeared to be kicked by Monaco goalkeeper Danijel Subasic , wich left the majority of social media disgraced by the decision, including Gallagher. 
If you had to show somebody a representation of what the Oasis singer is like on social media, then just send them this.No messing about: - Liam Gallagher (@liamgallagher) February 21, 2017 
Fortunately for Gallagher and co, the refereeing decision turned out to be irrelevant. Goals from Raheem Sterling, Sergio Aguero (2), John Stones and Leroy Sane sealed an important win for Pep Guardiola's side. 
But former Manchester United striker Radamel Falcao stole the show with an incredible dink over the helpless head of Willy Caballero . 
Here's that goal one more time: :heart_eyes: Le bijou de @FALCAO sur la pelouse de l'Etihad Stadium !!! #CITYASM pic.twitter.com/tQUgdmVHYa - AS MONACO :flag_mc: (@AS_Monaco) February 22, 2017 What a game! What a goal! @FALCAO with a sensational finish. :fire::fire::fire: #UCL #CityvMonaco https://t.co/q7mbLloqpr - BT Sport Football (@btsportfootball) February 21, 2017 
Gallagher then summed up both Falcao's goal and the entire 90 minutes with another bold, but beautiful Twitter post: Jesus Christ- Liam Gallagher (@liamgallagher) February 21, 2017 
Exactly, Liam.
